page.title: 08Population of Yewdale
page.content: The population of the block is concentrated at the southern edge, to the north of Coniston, in a part of the village called{Far End.}By counting houses, and estimating three people per house, approximately 50 people live in{Far End}and{Lower {Yewdale,}and with the outlying farms, a further 30 can be added. The centres of population are firmly sited in the sheltered parts of the main valleys, well above river flood levels. The only exceptions are a few cottages on the edge of{Tarn {Hows,}overlooking the main valley of {Yewdale,}and the{Youth Hostel}in the {Coppermines Valley,}which was originally a building associated with mining activity. Not all of the population can be regarded as permanent, because there are a few holiday homes.
